title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a responsive and modern admin dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It aims to provide a practical example of building a dynamic user interface with server-side rendering and client-side interactions, focusing on best practices for code organization, component reusability, and a seamless user experience. This repository serves as a learning resource and starting point for developers interested in building data-driven web applications with the Next.js framework.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focused on [insert the project's main purpose, e.g., creating a real-time communication platform or developing a data visualization tool]. It leverages modern web development practices and aims to provide [mention key features or benefits, e.g., a scalable and user-friendly experience or efficient data processing capabilities].

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep patterns, calculate their accumulated sleep debt, and visualize their progress towards achieving optimal rest. It serves as a practical demonstration of TypeScript development and showcases a simple yet effective way to track sleep habits.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code for my resume, built using LaTeX and incorporating a bit of HTML for specific styling and presentation elements. It serves as a dynamic and easily customizable project for maintaining my professional profile and showcasing my skills and experience.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project template built with Next.js 14 (pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), designed to accelerate the development of modern web applications. Leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and state management, this repository provides a solid foundation for projects utilizing these technologies and offers best-practice examples for implementing common features and patterns, covering topics such as user authentication, API integration, and component composition.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based dashboard built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet robotics system. This project focuses on providing a user-friendly interface for monitoring robot status, viewing sensor data, and potentially controlling robot behavior through interactive elements within the dashboard.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository, built using HTML and Python, focuses on visualizing geographical data on interactive maps. It serves as a project demonstrating techniques for creating dynamic map-based applications, falling under the project topic. It allows users to explore and interact with spatial datasets, providing a visually engaging way to understand geographical information.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask and PostgreSQL, designed to manage and interact with data. This project utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for front-end presentation and deployment tasks, respectively. It serves as a practical demonstration of full-stack development principles and best practices for building web applications using a modern Python framework.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a dynamic project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to be a collaborative idea board. This application provides a visual space to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize project ideas, leveraging modern web development practices for a smooth and interactive user experience. It facilitates easy sharing and discussion of concepts, making it ideal for project planning and team collaboration.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack voting application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS) that allows users to create and participate in polls. This project demonstrates modern web development practices and explores concepts related to user authentication, data persistence, and real-time updates within a project-based learning environment.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, houses a collection of projects focused on applying Python to finance. It explores various financial concepts and methodologies through practical code examples, providing a hands-on learning experience for anyone interested in leveraging Python for financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Express.js, and Vite.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide users with an interactive and insightful conversational AI experience. This project showcases modern web development techniques, combining front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with a robust back-end to explore the capabilities and potential applications of generative AI.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed for efficiently visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and explore ROS log data, aiding in debugging and understanding robot system behavior. It falls under the broader umbrella of ROS-related projects, offering a convenient way to gain insights from the often verbose ROS logging infrastructure.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a responsive and interactive event calendar built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository demonstrates dynamic calendar functionality, allowing users to easily view and manage events. The project focuses on providing a user-friendly interface and efficient event handling, serving as a practical example for learning and implementing web-based calendar solutions.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase, designed to provide a real-time asset tracking solution. This application leverages modern web development technologies to offer a user-friendly interface for managing and monitoring IoT devices and their associated data.  It serves as a practical example of integrating Supabase for backend services with a modern frontend framework.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a personal project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to explore and showcase interactive web development concepts. This repository serves as a learning ground and a portfolio piece, focusing on implementing dynamic user interfaces and engaging visual experiences.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 using the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React. It leverages MUI for the user interface, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and implements strong typing throughout the codebase. This project showcases a modern approach to e-commerce development and serves as a practical example for learning and building similar applications.
